intro: Lappula micrantha, commonly known as narrowleaf lappula, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and the plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Lappula micrantha is an annual herb that plays a minor role in local ecosystems but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
